channel.title: Looking for New Computer for gaming
channel.description:
Desktop
Price Range - 500-600 (Take about 5 months to get this much. GG)
Games - Minecraft, Runescape, Planetside 2, Stream Games.
Suggestions hints or anything would be lovely I don't know much about what to get so a link to a computer would be great!

item.title: Looking for New Computer for gaming
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

Seems like eyeownyew’s suggested PC would be sufficient. I don’t think you’ll get much better than that, anyway.

Read full topic

item.source: Looking for New Computer for gaming

item.title: Looking for New Computer for gaming
item.dc:creator: @Kozs Kozs
item.description:
@Kozs wrote:

[quote=“eyeownyew, post:17, topic:493272”][quote author=Lin link=topic=611505.msg4238244#msg4238244 date=1361679977]

Eh, wasn’t aware you didn’t have a monitor.

http://www.amazon.com/Asus-VE228H-21-5-Inch-Integrated-Speakers/dp/B00413PHDM/ref=sr_1_1?ie=UTF8&qid=1361652535&sr=8-1&keywords=asus+21.5"

I have, it’s great. Substitute this for the graphics card, total price ~$560

Would my FPS be poopy? My FPS is poopy with Planetside 2 and my current card is 512 MB
[/quote]Look at the chip it comes with. Radeon HD 7660D scores an 826 on videocardbenchmarks.net. I wouldn’t exactly call that poopy. Relatively poopy anyway.

You should get about 50-60FPS on max settings for Planetside 2. I haven’t ever played it (because the download is like 20gb), but it doesn’t seem any more graphically intense than Halo. If anything, the game would use lots of RAM/your CPU capacity but you’re more than set with the parts I linked you to.[/quote]

6GB Download

Read full topic

[/quote]Look at the chip it comes with. Radeon HD 7660D scores an 826 on videocardbenchmarks.net. I wouldn’t exactly call that poopy. Relatively poopy anyway.[/quote]
You should get about 50-60FPS on max settings for Planetside 2. I haven’t ever played it (because the download is like 20gb), but it doesn’t seem any more graphically intense than Halo. If anything, the game would use lots of RAM/your CPU capacity but you’re more than set with the parts I linked you to.

item.dc:creator: @Kozs Kozs
item.description:
@Kozs wrote:

eyeownyew:

All you require, yes. If you already have speakers, a keyboard, a mouse, and a WiFi adapter (assuming you use wireless). This is all you need for the parts of the desktop.

I need a Screen then.

item.source: Looking for New Computer for gaming

item.title: Looking for New Computer for gaming
item.dc:creator: @Kozs Kozs
item.description:
@Kozs wrote:

[quote=“eyeownyew, post:10, topic:493272”]HDD ($80): http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16822148840
Highly recommended, great ratings from me/my brother. 7200RPM, 1TB, yeah.

Processor/MoBo ($240): http://www.newegg.com/Product/ComboDealDetails.aspx?ItemList=Combo.1199688
I have both of these currently, they’re excellent. (@People who say you need Intel, you don’t, Intel just charges 300% more for the same exact product.)
This processor stays remarkably cool, I’ve seen it get to 35F and it has never gotten above 90F.

RAM ($50): http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16820231527
Me and my brother both have this ram also, quite nice. Decent frequency for high-end gaming, and not much will require more than 8GB of ram (if anything). To give you a comparison, currently I’m running iTunes, Chrome, Eclipse, Maplestory, and League and I’m only using 3GB of ram.

DVD Drive ($20): http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16827106276
Doesn’t even matter that much, but it is essential. Only thing that matters is it’s SATA and trusted.

Case/PSU ($36): http://microcenter.com/product/356586/Elite_Mid_Tower_ATX_Computer_Case_with_450_Watt_Power_Supply
Don’t let the price be misleading, this is a very trustworthy PSU and the case is pretty nice also. I’ve been using this for months without any problems. If you ever have any problems with the PSU, you can RMA it with no questions asked.

OPTIONAL:
Graphics Card ($170): http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16814130840
Excellent graphics card, my brother has this one. I don’t have a graphics card in my computer (the processor I linked you to has integrated graphics), this is an optional part. Recommended if you can afford.

HDD $80
Processor/MOBO $240
RAM $50
DVD $20
Case/PSU $36
+optional GFX $170

Total $596

Feel free to take out the graphics card if you’d rather buy a new monitor or something, honestly the integrated graphics is just fine. I play Skyrim @30fps on Medium settings. It can play any other games at 60fps at max settings, Skyrim is the most demanding game I’ve found so far (although I haven’t tried GW2).[/quote]
And this is all I need?

Read full topic
item.source: Looking for New Computer for gaming

item.title: Looking for New Computer for gaming
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

HDD ($80): http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16822148840
Highly recommended, great ratings from me/my brother. 7200RPM, 1TB, yeah.

Processor/MoBo ($240): http://www.newegg.com/Product/ComboDealDetails.aspx?ItemList=Combo.1199688
I have both of these currently, they’re excellent. (@People who say you need Intel, you don’t, Intel just charges 300% more for the same exact product.)
This processor stays remarkably cool, I’ve seen it get to 35F and it has never gotten above 90F.

RAM ($50): http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16820231527
Me and my brother both have this ram also, quite nice. Decent frequency for high-end gaming, and not much will require more than 8GB of ram (if anything). To give you a comparison, currently I’m running iTunes, Chrome, Eclipse, Maplestory, and League and I’m only using 3GB of ram.

DVD Drive ($20): http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16827106276
Doesn’t even matter that much, but it is essential. Only thing that matters is it’s SATA and trusted.

Case/PSU ($36): http://microcenter.com/product/356586/Elite_Mid_Tower_ATX_Computer_Case_with_450_Watt_Power_Supply
Don’t let the price be misleading, this is a very trustworthy PSU and the case is pretty nice also. I’ve been using this for months without any problems. If you ever have any problems with the PSU, you can RMA it with no questions asked.

OPTIONAL:
Graphics Card ($170): http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16814130840
Excellent graphics card, my brother has this one. I don’t have a graphics card in my computer (the processor I linked you to has integrated graphics), this is an optional part. Recommended if you can afford.

HDD $80
Processor/MOBO $240
RAM $50
DVD $20
Case/PSU $36
+optional GFX $170

Total $596

Feel free to take out the graphics card if you’d rather buy a new monitor or something, honestly the integrated graphics is just fine. I play Skyrim @30fps on Medium settings. It can play any other games at 60fps at max settings, Skyrim is the most demanding game I’ve found so far (although I haven’t tried GW2).

Read full topic

item.title: Looking for New Computer for gaming
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

If you don’t want to/know how to build your own, look into CyberPower PCs and iBuyPower PCs. They’re fantastic for their prices. www.newegg.com

Read full topic
item.source: Looking for New Computer for gaming

item.title: Looking for New Computer for gaming
item.dc:creator: @Kozs Kozs
item.description:
@Kozs wrote:

[quote=“eyeownyew, post:5, topic:493272”][quote author=Kozs link=topic=611505.msg4236464#msg4236464 date=1361589938]

Your best bet will be to build a desktop PC if you want one in that price range for gaming. You can’t pickup a decent laptop for gaming for under $900 that I know of.

^

I built my computer for $300 and it can play Skyrim. Honestly, building it is the best bet - you won’t get ripped off, and your computer will be exactly the way you want. If you wish, I can help you find links for decent/compatible parts.

I doubt I would be able to put it together
[/quote]
I didn’t know how to do it before I did mine. It’s really quite simple, a lot easier than you’d think. It’s like playing legos with some tools.[/quote]

300 USD to play games would be great. Links would be lovely.

Read full topic
